title: Citi Announces Major Volunteer Effort in Phoenix
summary: Phoenix - Citi announced that on Wednesday, March 14, nearly 1,000 volunteers will give back to the Phoenix community by supporting the work of several local nonprofit organizations. At two events, Citi employees, along with friends and family, will clearly show Citi's commitment to strengthening communities, participating in a number of activities that will make a lasting impact on the area.
tag-1: Citi Announces Major Volunteer Effort in Phoenix
tag-3: Phoenix – Citi announced that on Wednesday, March 14, nearly 1,000 volunteers will give back to the Phoenix community by supporting the work of several local nonprofit organizations. At two events, Citi employees, along with friends and family, will clearly show Citi's commitment to strengthening communities, participating in a number of activities that will make a lasting impact on the area.
tag-4: The volunteer effort is made possible by Citi's North America Consumer Banking organization, which is recognizing its top performers in Phoenix this week. The events include:
tag-5: "Volunteerism is a fundamental element of Citi's culture," said Jud Linville, CEO of Citi Cards. "We are proud that so many of our Citi colleagues and friends are giving their time to support the Phoenix community and the work of Ben's Bells and HandsOn Greater Phoenix, which have made a huge impact on many lives in Arizona."
tag-6: "We are thrilled to support and promote positive change in this community," said Cece Stewart, President of U.S. Consumer and Commercial Banking for Citi. "Today, through teamwork, hard work, and a passion for community service, our employees are rolling up their sleeves and helping to make Phoenix better."
tag-7: At the events, volunteers will participate from numerous Citi organizations, including Citi Cards, U.S. Consumer and Commercial Banking, CitiMortgage, Citi Retail Services, Operations and Technology and Global Consumer Marketing and Internet Office, to collaborate with Ben's Bells and HandsOn Greater Phoenix in support their projects and initiatives. The goal of the combined efforts is to make a significant impact on the lives of thousands of people in the Phoenix community and to inspire and empower residents to take action to create positive change.
tag-8: "We thank Citi for its incredible support today to help improve Roosevelt Row and downtown Phoenix," said Rhonda Oliver, Executive Director of HandsOn Greater Phoenix. "In one morning, Citi has made a significant contribution to the transformation of this district into a vibrant, creative neighborhood that residents of our entire city can enjoy."
tag-9: "Citi is proud to show Phoenix our strong commitment to improving the lives of individuals and families in the communities that we serve," said Rich Garside, Head of Global Consumer Operations and Technology for Citi. "Through the work of our hundreds of volunteers and our support of these great organizations, we hope to make a difference in this community today, making it a better place for everyone."
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-12: Ben's Bells Ben's Bells is a community art project with the mission to inspire, educate and motivate each other to realize the impact of intentional kindness and to empower individuals to act according to that awareness, thereby changing our world. Hundreds and hundreds of Ben's Bells are distributed randomly around the Tucson community two times each year by a team of committed volunteers. Hanging Ben's Bells is a special honor reserved for people who have been actively involved in the Ben's Bells Project. Each week a person who betters Tucson by spreading kindness is "belled," receiving a Ben's Bells gift pack.
tag-13: HandsOn Greater Phoenix HandsOn Greater Phoenix is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that empowers people to become engaged, take action and create positive change in their communities. HandsOn Greater Phoenix is an affiliate of HandsOn Network, an innovative alliance of volunteer organizations working to build community through service and civic engagement across the United States and abroad. For the last 19 years, HandsOn Greater Phoenix volunteers have been mentoring children, revitalizing neighborhoods, providing meals to the homeless, supporting seniors, caring for animals and protecting our environment. Volunteer projects are held in conjunction with pre-screened community service organizations, neighborhood associations and under-resourced schools.
